description:
Friendly staff delish coffee. I enjoyed sitting outside catching a break with some fresh air and sun.

I ordered the Macau iced coffee with almond milk! yummm
author: Erika P.

description:
Gee, I wish this closet of a place could be open after 4PM during the week, but I have to agree it would be impractical since it's a sliver of a spot that would crowd up if more than four people showed up and hung around beyond the duration of an espresso. Weekend hours would certainly be nice, but I assume the foot traffic in this part of SoMa is not enough to justify the extra hours. After all, we're talking about Folsom between 8th and 9th. Oh well, I've still been able to sneak over here because it's pretty close to my home.

The coffee is quite good with the beans from Cento Coffee who also supplies the beans at Cafe Lambretta (review: http://bit.ly/2umBsqm). I had the $3.25 Americano, and it was a rich jolt of goodness that I easily took away (photo: http://bit.ly/2JcrMnK). On my return visit, I went for the $4.25 Cafe au Lait (photo: http://bit.ly/2N3c949) because I had time to stick around at the tiny counter out front where I could see the hipsters saunter by. On both visits, the barista was really friendly and easy-going, traits that I would think are essential under such claustrophobic conditions.

COFFEE - 4 stars...those Cento beans pack a lot of good flavor
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...seriously?...it's a closet
SERVICE - 4 stars...I feel welcomed here
TOTAL - 4 stars...I could make it by 6PM, I swear
author: Ed U.

description:
Hole in the wall but packed with flavor. I love this little coffee shop! It has a lot of character and does not mess around with good coffee.

I went for the Macau iced coffee ($4.25) with almond milk, and it was just divine and pleasantly jolted me awake.

Cool barista!
author: Jess L.

description:
I love the Macau iced coffee with almond milk, super refreshing great flavors and best not too sweet. It's also a good local coffee shop at SOMA.
I am just thrilled with Vega.The customer service is outstanding
author: MariaAnne V.

description: Our team swings by Vega almost every day for a post-lunch pick me up. Raul is always super friendly and awesome. The quality of the coffee is superb and we're supporting a cool local business. What's not to love?
author: Casey S.

description: OMGoodness I was caught in the pouring rain and I think this coffee saved my life  I drink lots of coffee at a variety of places and today I am happy I was caught in the rain. It's so yummy. The staff here is friendly. They went through their products and helped me choose. It's a small place with a little patio. I'd totally come here again.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Great coffee shop in SoMa
Came here a Friday afternoon on my lunch break for a little pick me up. Got the nitro cold brew ($4.50) the coffee is stump town and the nitro brew had a nice smooth flavor and didn't taste watered down like a lot of ice coffee usually does. There were a couple pastries and even vegan granola bars to snack on. 
This place is small, only two tables outside and no inside seating. A perfect place to stop and get good coffee in a relaxed atmosphere
Oh- cash only *
author: Kelsey B.

description:
I frequently refer to Vega Cafe as the best cafe in San Francisco. The coffee is excellent. The guys that run it are super nice. I feel so lucky to work across the street from this place. Even though we have all the trappings I could ever want to make my own coffee drinks in my office, I prefer going to this place just because it is such a great experience and the drinks are so much better than anything I could get in the office.

Way to go Vega! Don't ever change!
author: Miles G.

description:
Great foamy premium latte in a closet-sized shop with cool racing vibrational frequencies all around and a mechanic getup in the back.  Yes, they make great coffee.  Yes, it does suck that they only accept cash- sorry guys it's 2016.  But, aside from Sightglass on 7th:  this is the best coffee this side of SOMA until you get to Hayes Valley. Your only option in the vicinity is the Starbucks on the gas station on Howard and 9th.  Too bad they close so damn early.  They don't chit-chat much, which I like.   I hate small talk with Baristas that eventually get to know your name because they call it out once you become a regular at their coffee shop.  Keep up the professional relationship guys - the moment I start wasting my introverted time smalltalking for my morning coffee is when I change coffee outfits.

Keep on keeping the conversation to a minimum, keep the place open longer and, for Christ's sake, accept credit cards guys.
author: Khash C.

description:
Good vibes and great coffee! Get away from your phone and computer and enjoy sipping your caffeine fix while listening to what Vega has playing on vinyl.

Highly recommend trying their fresh baked croissants  and Cento bars. They also have 8oz bags of beans so you can keep the coffee vibes going at home and the office.

Thanks Vega for keeping it real.
author: V V.

description: What a midday pick up.  The first time I had zero cash and they let me return later to pay them for my iced coffee.  The coffee is strong and bomb.  Definitely stop in if you're craving something delicious.
author: Kate G.

description:
Old school joint with a motorcycle vibe

Amazing coffee that puts me in a serious hyper rage all day. I never get my coffee with any dairy or non-dairy additives but this joint knows how to make something special. The Macau Coffee came out to be pretty sweet, but the soy latte was on point! It's a bit pricey for a specialty cup, but hey, I would pay Vega to keep me awake all day everyday!
author: Linda K.

description: Just happened to walk by this place on my way to out of the closet thrift shop, killing time in the city with shopping. Delicious Americano, and I'm a bit of a coffee snob. Drink my Americanos straight - no sugar or cream - it's all about the coffee. The owner was very real and friendly and told me about how they blend and roast their own coffee. You could tell I was interested, so he told me about the different blends, and I enjoyed it so much, I bought some to make at home. Give this place a try if you like coffee and you're in the Mission.
author: Jori K.

description: SImply astounding! Small, unique, friendly and the best coffee in the SOMA! Try the New Orleans Iced Coffee and croissants!
author: armon s.

description:
Nitro draft cold brew and single origin micro roasts made into pour overs and creamy lattes keep our office powered through the week.

Aside from the hella good coffee, the spot is pretty fresh.  They've got racks of vinyl records, and really cool shit to look at when you're standing in line.  The lines can get long, but it's worth waiting.  Heck, I don't do lines IRL, and I'll stand in line for anything they're pouring.

They've got non-coffee drinks that I like - jamaica (hibiscus) iced tea, hot peppermint-rose tea, and unsweetened drinking hot chocolate.

Oh, and cash only!
author: Isa H.

description:
Omg these reviews. Some of you people need help. I love the coffee here, I love the music from time to time, the handmade (like actually hand fucking made) sammys are the reason I get out of bed. This is the best coffee in SF, hands down. 

Yes, cash only for now, they are a really small business with low foot traffic. If you ask the other business owners in the neighborhood, you might see they struggle. Get over it. 

The ONLY downside are the patrons, seriously. I sit, listening to good music, and inevitably people sit close by and start talking about tech, without fail. They even use the TINY space for meeting and interviews. You people are rude. Ruins a perfectly chill experience. AND I even tipped for a large group once because these "people" didn't think it necessary after several drinks were made. Calling these baristas rude... there is good reason. They are surrounded by lame start ups employing infants with no understanding of service work or appreciation for artisanal goods, while also dealing with SOMA street folk. Not an easy job at 6AM. Think about it.
author: Shana A.

description:
Their coffee is delicious! Absolutely no bitter finish. I drink nespresso coffee every day so I'm used to good coffee thank the good lord, but the cappuccino I ordered was so rich, it almost had chocolate notes to it. I'm so glad another yelper mentioned in his review that they are cash only; otherwise I would have awkwardly had a plastic rejection moment. 

I had a pleasant experience with the service, was greeted when I entered, and was thanked for visiting when I left. I guess the bad apple staff has left. If you've had a bad experience here in the past, please try again. The coffee is to die for, and there's a really cool mechanic's shop theme to the joint. I met here for an informational interview and the vibe on the outside patio was great.
author: Farah W.

description:
Charming - totally SF, and QUALITY.  John Quintos does it again.  Vega is nothing like you're average, everyday garage door coffee shoppe.  Seeing as how they're popping out all over SF as the Trend of 2010 continues it's hard to stand out amongst the crowd.  Vega has managed to do this with the small attachment of Goody Goodie providing quality pastries and baked goods to compliment your morning/afternoon/evening coffee.

Grab a coffee and go - on your scooter of course.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I LOVE the coffee here.  Whenever I'm in the area, I make sure to pop down to grab a soy latte ($4ish).  As others have said, they serve Blue Bottle Coffee here so you don't have to wait in line or fight the crowds at the official locations.  If you've signed up for "Perkville" you can check in at this location to earn points for free coffee (though I think 20 visits for 1 free drink is a bit much).

The cookies ($2.50?) are amazing; I think they're from "Goodie Goodie"?  I usually get the chocolate chip plain, with walnuts, or...wait for it.....with caramel popcorn!

Two things to remember: Yes, they are cash only and don't forget to put sugar into your soy drinks since they use unsweetened only. 

Enjoy. :)
author: Alice L.

description:
One of the best cappuccinos I've found in the city. Who says you need a La Marzocco to pull a good shot. This place is a testament to the barista. 

The cafe doubles as a ratty motorcycle repair shop or personal collection of vintage bikes. Having a similar attraction to broke down things that I will hopefully one day repair I wouldn't be surprised if the owner found the 2 group Vega machine he uses on craigslist for $100 along with the osteria grinder and brought them back to life to create this delicious nectar.

Honestly the first time I got a cappuccino I didn't check out his gear and left thinking, "oh well he's probably got a La Marzocco Linea or something. I mean how else could you get a shot so pure, not sour, not bitter." And that's because I'm an ignorant idiot. Judging a shop by it's machine is like, well, judging anything by how much money they spend on their crap. Doesn't automatically equate to quality. 

2nd time around I was surprised to see the tools matched the decor. I then bowed down and realized how shallow I had become in my coffee snobbery. Granted something has to work properly to create good things but that doesn't mean you need the latest and greatest. This is a true testament to the artist and not the tool. Like when you look at a wonderful photo your friend took and exclaim, "dude that Canon 5D is amazing."

Let this be a lesson to all of us. Go here. Get some coffee. Let the man do his job and remember it's not the tools that do the job it's the artist.

Oh yeah and what people say is somewhat true though, he doesn't chit chat really. But I didn't think it was because he was rude or negative. Maybe he just hates us all? I demand smiles!

Blue Bottle 17ft Ceiling Espresso.
author: Allen P.

description: Smells so good when I walk by in the morning. I had to stop in around 7:45 am. They perpare these delicious breakfast crosaunt bacon sandwhiches that are epic. It is cash only so make sure you have some on hand, prices are ridiculously reasonable. There's also an atm accross the street. My mornings are so much better now that I've found this delisious little place.
author: Jamie S.

description:
Date & Time:  Saturday February 13, 2010 @ 2pm
Companions:  Husband & Doggie
Scene:  Hipsters
Vibe:  Chill
Decor:  Urban Industrial Coffee Kiosk
Service:  Friendly & Nice
Imbibe:  Blue Bottle Soy Latte 
Devour:  Fresh-Baked Goody Goodie Cookies Served in Coffee Filters & Rosemary Salted Caramels
Total:  $9
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
What a bunch of jerk offs! I would probably be an asshole, too if I had to serve all the yuppies that have been steadily moving into the area for the last 4 years... but the people staffed are the same yuppies they try to separate themselves from. Do they think we don't know? Maybe they don't know.

I walked in with my co-worker and the Asian dude and White dude with that really gross long beard just stared at us. No one else was there and we were right in of their faces. No one asked us if we needed anything, so I just asked if I could have a croissant. No response. The Asian guy turned around to fiddle with some gadgets. I looked at the hair dude (by the way, you're supposed to trim it once it gets to a certain length. And that look doesn't fit your really innocent, naïve, privileged eyes) and asked if there's someone that could help us and he point to the Asian guy. The hairy dude wasn't doing anything. Just standing in front of the espresso machine, one arm leaning atop it.

I got my croissant. Still they said nothing.

NEVER. AGAIN.
author: Camille R.

description:
It's so tiny it's easy to miss but Vega is worth seeking out for your caffeine pick me up needs. The scooter themed décor is charming. There are pictures of scooters and 1 wood bench. The shop/stall is named after a Lambretta scooter. Individual drip coffee is available.

* Blue Bottle Coffee latte ($3.50): they have non-fat milk (yay), flavor was rich, deep and smooth but the latte wasn't hot enough

There weren't many pastries to choose from but the croissants looked good and they carry Goody Goodie cookies (so good and even better with coffee).
author: Lolia S.

description:
Nothing like wandering the streets after a SF Giant World Series Parade and landing in one of the hidden gems of coffee making.  You had me at blue bottle.  It's always the blue bottle.  I can't help it.  

Keep it simple and stay the way you are Vega.  You rock.
author: Maria S.

description:
Amazing coffee, worth it even if they don't have a bathroom and wifi ;).
The guy randomly gifted me a croissant for free.

Very Nice place!
author: Jeremy M.

description:
My favorite here is the Macau iced coffee. The only reason why I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is: 
1. Their AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS croissants are always sold out by 9:30am :(
2. Cash only :( I never have cash
author: Gloria Z.

description: Quaint little place on folsom. Cool décor and a nice staff. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone walking by
author: Marcus R.

description: this is a cute place to get coffee.  i remember when it was just a little stall, and now it has expanded.  i can't remember what beans they use, b/c i got the nitro coffee, which was interesting.  the menu is different, and i like that they have various iced coffees, including a vietnamese iced coffee.
author: Helen T.

description: Convenient location, awesome pour over coffee!!!  I love the clutch assembly blend which is a mix of African and South American coffee regions.  I have to add the style of this coffee shop brings me back to when I traveled to Italy last.
author: Tony S.

description:
The coffee is wonderful.  However, the service is like  watching a PhD seminar in hipster douche-baggery.
I come here a lot because I work nearby and I like great coffee.  The guy who seems to either own or manage the place is always really nice and none of my criticism applies to him.  But most of the other baristas are wretched to deal with.  Won't even acknowledge you when you walk in the door, make a point of slowly going about a variety of passive-aggressive chores before condescending to make your drink (even if the place is empty), barely restraining themselves from rolling their eyes at your presumption in thinking you should be allowed to have them serve you... if you've lived in San Francisco awhile, you've probably seen this routine at some point, but I have to say, these guys NAIL it.    
So over it.  Guys, your coffee is good. But not that good.
author: Sarie L.

description: Great hole in the wall place. They are cash only and serve blue bottle coffee. Very friendly and they have amazing croissants baked in house!
author: Lorraine R.

description:
Cash Only = bad (more signage please)
Blue Bottle Coffee = good!

When you're down the street from Squareup.com, the cash only policy is lame and so 1990s. Get with the program YO!?
author: John H.

description: Let me say one thing. I'm a complete coffee snob. I travel the world for work and I drink my coffee in every corner. The Swiss water noir (decaf) cappuccino at vega is one of the best I've ever had.
author: Matt V.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker as I can count the number of times I've had it in my lifetime on one hand.  Today's little adventure was just my third.  I'm sure I could have chosen any place for a cup of coffee since I'm pretty certain I don't know the difference between good coffee and bad, but I chose Vega at Langton because I was curious and it's very near my work.

I worked until one in the morning the previous night and found myself having difficulty keeping my eyes open the next day.  I didn't want my boss to catch me nodding off so I decided to go for a walk and look for a remedy.  The New Orleans style ice coffee from Vega at Langton did the trick, and surprisingly I liked the cold bitterness of the coffee.  I slurped it down the way it was served to me ice cold with just a dribble of cold milk.  It solved my problem and kept me awake until I left work at midnight.  I'm pretty sure I won't make this a habit, but I was definitely glad it was there.

Thanks Vega at Langton!  I didn't get yelled at by my boss today thanks to you!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Oh, Vega. You've been my neighbor for years, and I've been a regular customer for most of your time in SoMa, but only now I've written a review about your wonderful service. 

Hands down, this is the best value for Blue Bottle Coffee in SF -- and, yes, Vega's coffee is priced lower than Blue Bottle itself. Compare 2.75 at the Mint location of blue bottle with 2.50 at Vega. 

Best of all, most of the employees are an absolute delight, especially the owner Jon. They're all great people, each exceptional in their craft for lovingly prepared coffee. The line moves fairly quickly, and you're never waiting a fuckton for your coffee, unlike that shithole Philz on Van Ness.
author: Richard L.

description:
This place is a garage turned coffee spot. This is the place you want to come when you just need some good coffee and find yourself in the middle of nowhere SOMA, and have a cravin' for the caffeine that the overprice Sight Glass can't fix (or that your baller self just doesn't want to pay for...) 

You step into this spot, first thing I noticed was the standing coffee bar that spans across the entrance to this place --- it's made of a beautiful red door... Step in, order your blue bottle brewed coffee, get awesomely fast service, and get on out.

I went there recently and had the pleasure of getting a Chocolate Croissant... I don't know if it was because I was partially hung over, but as I bit into that Croissant, I saw a future in which my waist line will probably end up disappearing, because I just wanted to have this Chocolate Croissant EVERY_SINGLE_MORNING... The many layers of the croissant were visible. But the best part --- this croissant was fresh! The chocolate innards were still warm and meltyyyy!

I'll try out there cookies soon enough (as apparently those are awesome as well!)

Come for the coffee, sneak a baked good into your order, and you'll most definitely be on the path to enlightenment! Or at least to probably walkin' up some extra hills from the addiction that will ensue...
author: Mike V.

description: Best cappuccino I've ever had. Great flavor without sweetening, which I usually do. Cafe con leche great flavor too.
author: Mary T.

description: If you are not into light-roast and sour citrus flavors in your coffee then this is the place for you.  Vega serves up excellent options of medium-roast Blue Bottle blends.  And it's a cool little spot to visit as well - vespas and motorcycles adorn the space with photographs from associated rallies back in the day.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place is strictly functional: drive up, get really good coffee. No real seats, no food of substance.

But...and... the coffee is *really good*. Sure it's Blue Bottle (usually a liability for me #overrated #pretentious) but they do it right and 86 the attitude.

Easy parking on the street. For a purely caffeinated transaction, go to Vega.
author: Diane B.

description:
Super cute cafe in the SOMA, with a super cute barista chick that makes one heck of a latte! I love Blue Bottle lattes, and when done right, the drink has a lovely, light, foamy texture that I so utterly adore. I'm not sure of the girl's name, but she has the magic touch and even makes a pretty pattern on top! Love it!

The Macau iced coffee is also something that sets Vega apart from all the others. In a nutshell, it's an iced latte and was perfect for a warm Autumn day like today.
author: Christina N.

description:
A Happy (Kinda High) Vega Coffee Lover.

My first time and the barista was a doll. She took her time w/ making my latte and damn is it good. 

CASH ONLY

Uploaded a few photos too :O
author: David C.

description:
Never would've found this spot if I didn't stop by its neighbor Digital Pickle, but I'm so glad I did! From the reviews I read, I to had try the Macau iced coffee. It lives up to its hype!

I gave this place 4 stars because it would've been great to be able to use my card. Note to everyone: Bring cash.
author: Sarah A.

description:
For the first time last month I was here in a private meeting with my client, yeah... my client preferred it for taking place of our meeting.

I just wanted to get a cookie with my drink but she inspired me to get their iced coffee. Really good it was. Anyway some drawbacks made me upset like there is no Wi-Fi and credit card was not acceptable.

Definitely will come back only for Macau Iced Coffee which was great.
author: Amy A.

description:
This place has ATTITUDE without the TUDE ... do you know what I mean?  This place is no where near the geometric loci of pretentious and glam.  It is in a totally different universe and will freakin' blow you away!

There are lots of literal and figurative "Hole in the Wall" places SOMA, but this is a little grab-and-go coffee, sandwich and pastry place cleverly hidden behind a corrugated metal roll-up garage door.

This afternoon, I stumbled upon Vega during my afternoon caffeine search.  I chose the Chiapas blend which is a fair trade coffee harvested in southern Mexico.  The best way to describe Chiapas is an up-front rich nutty flavor with a lingering pleasant bittersweet after palate.

All coffees at Vega are purchased from Blue Bottle Coffee Company whose motto, attributed to Antoine de Saint-Exupery is " ... perfection is finally attained not when there is no longer anything to add, but when there is no longer anything to take away."  Nice!
author: David C.

description:
Best Americano I've ever had, and they retail Blue Bottle, which is ideal for the returning tourist like myself.  

I like that this place doesn't allow you to loiter.  It prevents the douchey scenesters from inflating their self-important egos... (yeah I'm talking to you guy at Starbucks reading Kafka, Marx, and the like)

I only gave four stars, because they could really offer more oz of liquid.  I like to buy one large coffee, not two small ones.
author: Kendie Kane L.

description:
I'm definitely coming back because my Macau Iced Coffee was great, and I'd like to see what all the five star reviews for service are all about. My barista didn't seem to care for me much at all, and was much more respectful to the guy that came after me.. even interrupting me in the middle of my ordering to help the other guy. I just wanted to get a cookie with my drink. 
After the other guy left I finished ordering my cookie and left. I made sure to leave a good tip to kill him with kindness.
The cookie wasn't even that good -__-
author: Valerie H.

description: I came here because I was curious about the Macau Iced Coffee. Verdict is that it's really good! On a hot day (still waiting for one of those) I'll be back for another!
author: Betty C.

description: Wish there were more places to sit around, because the coffee here is fantastic. Serve Blue Bottle and you can get everything from a latte to a few specialties like Macau Iced Coffees. Would come here again to grab a strong coffee quickly.
author: Lisette P.

description: Delicious! We tortured this man with drinks for a crew of 12-15 people (for about a week mind you) and he slammed them all out in a jiffy.
author: real b.

description:
Most excellent coffee.  Very chill staff.  Unique decor that I love cause i'm a motor head.

If you are looking for a good cup for your SoMa stroll then stroll over to Vega.
author: Miguel C.

description: Blue Bottle coffee cheaper than I can get it at Blue Bottle? Yes, please! They have have deliciously flaky butter croissants...I'm already craving a second one.
author: Laura C.

description:
Best coffee in town, most of the time. The pull is a little inconsistent but even a bad pull here is better than 3 barrel and WAY less snooty than blue bottle without the line. I'm from Seattle the mecca of EXCELLENT COFFEE and I gotta say SF people you don't know jack about good coffee as a whole except for a handful of places and of them this is the gem.

The Goody Goodie products are AMAZING. I live in the Sunset aka land of no good coffee and I drive the 1/2 there to get my fix. If that's not love I don't know what is.
author: Kitten M.

description: nice staff, blue bottle, not the nicest location but its close to work. very satisfied :) try their cold brew!
author: Kevin E.

description: Blue bottle coffee and solid cappuccinos...
author: Austin P.

description:
Much more caffeine and quite tastier than the run of the mill starbucks. Can't go wrong with an ice macau on a sunny morning.

Parking can kind of suck though.

Bonus kudos for the scooters in the shop.


CASH ONLY
author: Christina C.

description:
I was planning on stopping at Peet's for my latte but I randomly stumbled across Vega and saw that they have Blue Bottle. Score! 

Next time I stop by, I will: 1) get a friggin' cup cover (I was trying to be green) so that I don't slosh my coffee over my shoes while hurriedly crossing the street; and 2) try the Macau ice coffee.
author: Bella L.

description: cutest little hole in the wall coffee shop ever. Great strong coffee !
author: Lauren V.

description:
On a chilly December morning, this spot was walkable and open very early in the morn'

Wanted a tasty cup with no BS. Not only was there no BS, but there was no communication. The barista was in her own zone for sure. And I wasn't invited.

The coffee took days to make, but it came finally and was most importantly: hot. 

Surrounded by vintage vespas, I sipped my Blue Bottle beans with pleasure. Oh and thank goodness I brought a banana.
author: David F.

description:
Quite possibly better than going to Blue Bottle itself.
Pastries are scrumptious and served in a cone shaped coffee filter.
The java is perfect.  Perfect.
author: Leif N.

description: Great coffee hole-in-the-wall. Very cheap for what you get and the staff are mega-friendly. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Michael K.

description:
My short and sweet review: 

This place packs delicious, STRONG coffee into a unique and amazing atmosphere. 

Truly a hole in the wall, so slow down or you're bound to miss this place.

Don't come here planning to sit down - there's a little bench, but that's about it for seating. 

THE SCOOP: Looking to put some hair on your chest? Get a black coffee here and enjoy the caffeine rush!
author: Tom A.

description:
Espresso was in between, neither good nor bad.
Bleu Bottle beans, too roasted beans + heavy handed barista.
But that yellow Bajaj sulky is 5 stars!
author: Dario B.

description:
Maccau was very good . . . It was recommended to me by two customers in front of me and it was well worth the $3.50 for an iced coffee :)

Their menu is a bit limited for me and cash only kinda sucks but I will definitely be back.  This is a very soma-hipster place (if you're into that).  

Also, the barrista was very friendly (a plus in my book).
author: Banana S.

description:
Good Joe, albeit at two-fiddy for a 12 oz drip.

But this is culture, not coffee!!!  Right?

OK, try Capricorn...
author: Rob T.

description:
Awesome every time.  

Coffee is delicious and robust in all forms -  espresso (nice 'n strong), latte (smooth), Macau Iced Coffee (yum).  Cool decor, good vibe, great pastries, chill staff, AND next to Goodie Goody Cookies, win!
author: Evan S.

description: My latte tasted as good as the foam art looked. And they brew Blue Bottle. Nom nom.
author: Taylor S.

description: I come here once or twice a week and it is always the same...Greeted with a smile and warm morning conversation. The coffee is always amazing! I converted the most religious Starbucks drinker into a fan of Vega! You really can never go wrong with Blue Bottle...It works miracles!
author: Katie H.

description:
The best non black iced coffee I have had in my life- and this time I was not sick!

Creamy but not too creamy and cold and iced and delicious and ZOMG you gotta try it.
author: Skye W.

description: Definitely good for cold New Orleans coffee in the afternoon... Decent drip, but I prefer Sight Glass up the street for that...  Good espresso drinks... Great chocolate croissants...  Wish the owner would buy a heater for his employees... :)  When it's cold outside I feel so bad for them b/c of the open garage layout
author: Will W.

description: I love the Macau Iced Coffee. Please bring it to Cento, and bring the service too. The people working at Macau are always nicer than the people at Cento.
author: B C.

description:
Vega was the first coffee shop I found, a few blocks from my home. The menu is short and sweet and the decor is pretty cool- who doesn't like vespas? Being from out-of-town, I'm accustomed to everywhere taking Visa or debit, so it was kind of a shock for me to order a latte, have it served, and then realize that I had no cash and couldn't pay! Shoot.

However, the guy who made my latte said "pay for it tomorrow!" and I think I looked at him like he had ten eyeballs. He was trusting a total stranger. That is so surreal.

I did come back the next day, cash in tow to pay my debt, and got another amazing, perfectly-poured latte. There is something about the magic of 'blue bottle coffee' that makes me want to live in SF forever. 

The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because their hours are a bit limited- 7:30am till 4pm on weekdays and 10am to 3pm on Saturdays.
author: stephanie v.

description: Another perfect mocha this morning. Thank you Vega at Langton!
author: Ann M.

description:
Thank GOD for a good coffee place in that area of SOMA!! I was getting so bored and sick of all the places near our office and was about ready to give up. 

The other day I was biking down Folsom and saw a sign for blue bottle and knew my days of shitty starbucks were over!!!

Great coffee, really nice baristas and at least a good location for me......
author: Susanna B.

description:
OMGSOGOOD. Love this joint!
Only a stoplight away from where my client works. Easy menu. Nice rich coffee. interesting set up. a bagillion times better then starbucks. The girl working was nice, she overheard my boss's opinion on a drink and suggested what to tell the barista next time he's in. 

nice.
author: Christina C.

description:
Five stars for the best Macau iced coffee and iced citrus green tea ever. It's TDF. They serve Blue Bottle and it's damn good.
Plus the owner is super nice and helpful. I love independent coffee places and it's conveniently located near work. Love, love, love!!! Also scooter themed, great for my SB. If you want a croissant you had better get there early!
author: Catty C.

description: A very neat little coffee place. Not really a coffee shop, its more of a drop in coffee joint and there Iced Macau is a MUST on a warm San Francisco day. A SOMA must. Don't come here to sit down and sip your espresso with your laptop out but nevertheless the place still is worth a stop for a great coffee.
author: Shane H.

description:
Friendly people, tiny garage space, great bar looking onto the street.  

Good/proper espresso, and they offer you a glass of sparkling Gerolsteiner (that's what they served me, I'm not just dropping names) to go with.  

You get the sense the people working there care about the place, and it comes through.  That's not common, and impressive given the people working here don't appear to be the owners.  Good service plus good coffee, and a great atmosphere, would be five stars.   

Minus one star because it's run by the guys who ran 330 Ritch, so you know there is vanity in the air.  That's a ding to authenticity, right?  Takes something away for me anyway, knowing that the place was founded by a couple sweet dudes who like scooters because they can "get around in style and not wrinkle our tailor made suits jetting around the city." (from the website).  Come on.  Guys, you don't need to hit on girls 100% of the time, like on your website.  

Still, well executed, these guys have made SF their home so fine, a good stop mid-ride to work.
author: Peter H.

description: The coffee was good but beware that there is no place to sit. This means that they have to give you your coffee in a paper cup which really ruins the experience.
author: Sameer P.

description: I love Vega; it occupies that sweet spot that is the nexus of two of my favorite things, scooters and coffee! With scooter memorabilia around the room, Vega is an unpretentious, very reliable and very cool spot to get your coffee (Blue Bottle beans). While not a place to hang out and work on a laptop, the operation is small, located inside a roll-top garage, and caters to the sidewalk crowd. The coffee menu is limited; It is all about brewing the straightforward cup of coffee here, and a perfect, full-bodied cup at that.  But beyond the coffee/latte/espresso/cappuccino they do make two specialty drinks, the New Orleans Iced (with chickory) and the sweet/creamy Macao. Both are delicious!
author: Mark N.

description:
We really needed a good coffee place in the neighborhood and we finally got one right off Folsom and 9th. 

Got a latte and a Hayes Valley macchiato (which she pulled twice for me to make sure it was perfect). We sat in the sun, watched traffic, sipped our drinks and relaxed. It's cheaper than the speedmart starbucks and as an additional bonus: they are adding pastries next week as well.
author: B S.

description:
The guys are Old School SF.
its the total hole in the wall Industrial look that belongs in the neighborhood.
No Frills
Killer Coffee
I didn't see any pretentious Yuppies there, even though SF's permeated with them.
It was Quite nice.
I was spun off their coffee for the rest of the day.
author: vinnie g.

description:
Finally Finally Finally.

Every since I lost my beloved SOMA Café on Howard (its was bought, closed and close to being opened as something entirely different) I have not been able to fill the void on flavorful yet strong coffee.

This place does it and then some. I know that Blue Bottle coffee is the latest and greatest trend in the SF coffee scene. I was a bit reluctant to fall into its hip clutches but I have to say, "I drank the Kool-Aid and I likey"!

These guys are really really nice and totally appreciate you supporting them. And I appreciate them supporting my caffeine jones.

This is not a sit down, surf the net recreate your own Friends episode coffee shop. It's a kiosk in a cool SOMA building that provides the down and dirty good stuff and gets you on your way with a smile.

Highly recommend.
author: Cathy M.

description:
...asked for a latte extra hot and received one with room temp milk. Bleah!
When I spoke to the barista she confirmed that I did order it extra hot but they don't  "do" extra hot. She claimed that blue bottle doesn't believe in burning the milk as it challenges the flavor of the bean. Whatever. I just wanted a hot cup of coffee. 
...the barista wasn't giving attitude just the company line? 
..easy enough in this city to go someplace else and I did.
author: Angel B C.

description: Finally made it here ... Cool little Coffee place right off the street .. Serves great coffee with an minimal selection of pastries and such ... Service was OK, maybe a bad day .,, it is gray and rainy outside ... but all in all its an OK place ... I like Star stream up the street a little better, but that's just me ...
author: Anthony S.

description: A charming operation slinging splendid Blue Bottle coffee and delicious Irish oatmeal right out of a soma garage. A nice way to start a sunny San Francisco morning.
author: Jason B.

description: I expected it to be really great since it's "blue bottle" coffee and all. The lady put too much milk in my latte so I couldn't really taste the coffee as much. Sightglass coffee is still my fave and the people who work there are way nicer. The girl at vega didn't even crack a smile. Am I asking too much?
author: Nori L.

description: This place makes me happy :)  The atmosphere and the people behind the bar are delightful ... and they serve blue bottle... what is not to like?
author: Talia S.

description: Love it! I reroute on to Folsom Street just to have an excuse to stop by Vega for my caffeine fix.
author: M R.

description:
Delicous coffee, great people.  I will ride across town to have an espresso here at Vega.  You can just set your bike down right out front and enjoy the sites and sounds of Folsom.  Its great to see the rest of the world passionate about bikes and espresso.  Woohoo...the world is getting better.

****Bonus****
They bring in Goody Goodie cookies on Tuesdays.  I have had the cookies at the Bay Area Discovery Museum.  Best cookie ever!
author: mark g.

description: They recently stepped up their coffee it tastes like, and they offer a few varieties to choose from. Solid drip coffees and expert-made coffee drinks. A little expensive at 2.50 for a drip, but it's Blue Bottle in SF, so what would you expect?
author: Sean A.

description: Good coffee, less expensive than neighboring joints, but only cash.
author: Julie H.

description: Omg I really love getting my coffee here before work its very yummy and even though the service can be hit or miss I mean who cares? Just give me my coffee and its all good.
author: Jamie K.

description: I have a sick obsession with blue bottle coffee so this review must be taken with a grain of salt. I like this little place a lot, good atmosphere and friendly staff are always important and this succeeds in both of those categories. They use a drip method to make coffee which make take just a little bit longer but is totally worth the wait. Though I have to admit I do find it hard to give less than a 5 star rating to a place that serves blue bottle and serves it well. If you're down in the area and looking for a good cup of coffee this is my best recommendation
author: Prescott f.

description: Five stars, this is my favorite spot in the morning and all the employees are super cool and say hi out in the real world. Love this place, their Iced Coffee and Horchata Iced coffee is the bomb!
author: radnar d.

description: What SOMA used to be, small neighborhood feel coffee shop, thanks for bringing it back!
author: Marco M.

description: The coffee is great; I would come here more often if they accepted credit cards like the place around the corner.
author: Lion G.

description:
Attitude without the tude?  Er...no, don't know what that's supposed to mean.

More like Attitude with a capital A.  No double espresso, only "espresso" at the price of a double.  (It was a long shot, but still why the price of a double?  A long single shot is still a single shot).

And the coffee is not so awesome.  Nice crema on the top, but still way too bitter.  I'd give them 3 stars for the coffee, but the ridiculous snobbery took it down to 2 stars.

Oh, and no espresso to go.  When I asked for it to go, she just looked at me and said "no we don't."  Down to 1 star for rudeness.
author: Ritch G.

description: Super cool little coffee joint, love the looks of the place it's hip and edgy. Super tasty coffee, AMAZING chocolate chip cookies...oh man...so so so good.  Love this place!
author: Sonya D.

description:
how can a place with no chairs, wi fi or even a front door be so worthy of a trip for coffee? because the coffee is off the friggen hook thats why. i go way way out of my way to get my fix on here because its worth it.
if you love coffee (im not talking all you starbucks fans, cause lets face it you dont love coffee) you must give this place a try.
one hint. for some reason they serve thier coffee just over warm so plan on drinking it right away. a few minute trip back to your office or work and it will need a moment in the microwave
author: Mattew W.

description: Very good coffee, very friendly service.  This is an excellent little coffee shop that is absolutely worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Jessica J.

description:
They have great coffee and its super convenient  for me... They opened a little before Pinkys down the street, But Pinkys is doing it better... Vega better step there game up! Fast!!!  Loyalty can only last so long when chocolate bear claws are around!!!


I do love how the always remember my drink though!!
author: SFone D.

description:
Hard to find unless you know where it is.  Also not open late.

Those aside, perfect in every way.  I try to stop here on my walk to work for a drip or americano.  Modestly priced, friendly, and good.  A stop off here can make any morning better.
author: Kent S.

description: Very psyched to get a proper Blue Bottle Coffee vendor in my neighborhood. Had a great cappuccino pull this morning. Vega is set up very much like the BBC in Hayes Valley (as a kiosk in a garage), but it's an independent shop run by the folks who had the Lambretta Cafe on Polk--and the scooter theme continues here at Vega. The BB coffee is great (as you know). Gotta give it 5 stars, because of the quality, the friendliness, and balls it takes to set up a tiny coffee kiosk on a block before everyone else shows up, and they turn the area into an acronym (I'll be the first to suggest MOFO:  Middle of Folsom).
author: Tom M.

description: Ok ok i only hesitate to give 5 stars because it's still a little pricey and isn't quite as special-simple-like as the nearby original/true (?) blue bottle spots (like in Hayes Valley and FiDi and the Ferry plaza carts).  BUT I much love it for being where it is and having chocolate croissants and a few sandwich choices and iced coffee and some other good special coffee choices (which i forget at the moment exactly what they are) and mochas to go with the usual few good and basic espresso and drip choices.  Plus it's always a nice genuine feel/ambiance/service/etc.  It's a great spot.
author: Today Y.

description: I love Vega. With it's sibling Cento cafe at Ritch St, Vega is just as awesome.  We need more places like this! The blue-bottle coffee, atmosphere and vibe is just delicious.  Can't wait to stop by again try the Macau.
author: Kat D.

description: Wanted to add to my review from 6/20  Try the sandwiches.  Simple a baguette with just the right stuff on em.  I get their about 10 am and always at three to pick from.  Nice.  Thanks.
author: B G.

description: And they also have a good selection of different loose leaf teas from the Red Blossom Tea company.
author: Michael P.

description: My boss and I stopped in this morning. Very friendly staff and great coffee. Check out the New Orleans style iced coffee for a nice treat on a warm day. Now that we have good coffee near the office I'll never step foot in Starbucks again! Thanks Vega!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Just visited Vega this morning with my coworkers for our morning coffee run. I knew I loved the place when I saw the industrial roll-up door, Blue Bottle Coffee signage and took my first sip of my "New Orleans Style Iced Coffee". Very reminiscent of the Blue Bottle Coffee location in Hayes Valley. I'm awake now... and love this place. See ya guys tomorrow morning!
author: Greg Ciro T.

description: i like wandering aimlessly in the SOMA and happening upon places like Vega. the doppio I got was delightfully strong and an appropriate contender for my usual SOMA coffee spot of sightglass. and like Sightglass, Vega's digs are spartan- with nary a space to sit. but no matter, the warmth emanating from the miniscule space was enough to fuel me through the rest of my rainy walk through the neighborhood.
author: ray e.

description: Simply put, this place delivers Blue Bottle espresso drinks without the Blue Bottle attitude.  Hands down the nicest staff in the city and excellent drinks every time.  When it just seems like I'm going to have a hard time getting going in the morning, Vega is the cure.  They even have lovely little croissant sandwiches to go with your latte.  A gem here in SOMA.
author: Natalie S.

description: deeeeelicious coffee in my neck of the woods...Really great service too. I just wish that they would open on the weekends...or maybe just a tad earlier on the weekdays...
author: Angela J.

description: I love this place and the crew is fantastic.  Seriously, I am originally from Seattle and a total coffee snob.  The crema and velvet foam here rivals Vivace Espresso in Seattle.  Love, love, love.
author: Rick R.

description: The macchiato was perfect. Looking forward to making this my new coffee spot.
author: Juan Carlos A.

description: Currently drinking a hayes valley espresso cappuccino and it is divine. The staff is friendly and the coffee is delicious. I wish they were open at 7 and on Saturdays, but working from home two days a week lets me get my fix. I like the garage set up. Very non-descript. Looks like an artist studio behind. Love that smooth am radio.
author: Michael M.

description: I'm a huge fan.  Vega is my first stop in the morning.  I order a drip coffee with a chocolate filled croissant.   The croissants are made fresh each morning - out by 8:30 AM and gone by 10:00 AM  The staff are incredibly friendly and the atmosphere is fun.
author: Ben S.

description: best latte ever. i don't drink coffee often but but i'll have their latte/coffee/machiato anytime.
author: curi k.

description: So thrilled that a kiosk serving Blue Bottle Coffee has opened on my route to work.  The baristas were super friendly (and cute!) and made a perfect cappuccino.  Mmm, blue bottle!  No more Starbucks for this lady.
author: Mari C.

description: Oh my, I ordered an oatmeal with my cafe au lait, both were really good . Good  price  compared with Blue Bottle at Mint Plaza, 5 bucks versus 11, though you get a lot more oatmeal at BB and their coffee is better.  But the takeout spoon the woman gave me had oatmeal on it, so I commented that the spoon was dirty, and she looked at me with a blank look and said that she had used it to stir my oatmeal. Maybe I'm weird, but I want a clean spoon.
author: judith m.

description: these folks know how to make a cappucino. and it looks pretty too.
author: pauline t.

description: Yeah -- now open till 5 pm Mon - Fri!!!
author: Elle D.

description: great coffee, lovely pastries next door
author: A P.
